claims.text: Healthcare is undergoing a transformation, driven by data, computing power and smart techniques such as AI.
claims.speaker: Pascal Soriot
claims.context: Homerton College lecture titled 'What Science Can Do', discussing digital transformation of healthcare industry
claims.rhetoricalFunction: Frames AI as part of epochal industry transformation, positioning AstraZeneca within a historic shift in healthcare

claims.text: Our ultimate goal is to improve the lives of people. By developing new treatments for people suffering from diseases that cannot be cured today, by creating great jobs through economic development.
claims.speaker: Pascal Soriot
claims.context: Homerton College lecture on AstraZeneca's mission and innovation strategy
claims.rhetoricalFunction: Anchors AI and innovation work in specific falsifiable moral outcomes: curing disease and creating jobs

claims.text: We want to collaborate, operate in a porous environment where ideas can be shared.
claims.speaker: Pascal Soriot
claims.context: Homerton College lecture discussing AstraZeneca's open innovation approach
claims.rhetoricalFunction: Defines organizational character as open, collaborative, permeable to external ideas

claims.text: If you want to help patients treat their diseases better, if you want to also save money overall from the healthcare, I think you're willing to integrate digital technologies and pharmaceuticals that will help you diagnose diseases better.
claims.speaker: Pascal Soriot
claims.context: CGTN BizTalk interview on AI integration in pharmaceutical industry
claims.rhetoricalFunction: Links AI adoption to specific patient outcomes and healthcare cost reduction

claims.text: Europe is losing ground. They're focused more on social benefits and managing costs. It's like one company is trying to drive the top line, creating opportunities and economic growth, while another company is trying to manage costs and staying flat on the top line. That doesn't work.
claims.speaker: Pascal Soriot
claims.context: Fortune interview explaining AstraZeneca's $2.5 billion US investment and why Europe is falling behind in innovation
claims.rhetoricalFunction: Frames European status quo as unviable, justifying strategic shift toward US innovation ecosystem
claims.notes: While not explicitly about AI, this survival-framing justifies AstraZeneca's shift to US where AI/innovation ecosystem is stronger

claims.text: We are very optimistic about what AI and digital transformation can do. But we also need to be vigilant and ensure that we harness these technologies ethically and responsibly.
claims.speaker: Pascal Soriot
claims.context: Investment Reports interview on AI adoption philosophy at AstraZeneca
claims.rhetoricalFunction: Frames ethical responsibility as overriding commercial enthusiasm for AI
claims.notes: Pre-existing specimen quote elevated to purpose claim

claims.text: These advances are accelerating innovative science and the delivery of life-changing medicines.
claims.speaker: Pascal Soriot
claims.context: Investment Reports interview on AI impact in drug development
claims.rhetoricalFunction: Links AI capabilities to specific outcome of delivering life-changing medicines faster
claims.notes: Pre-existing specimen quote elevated to purpose claim

claims.text: There is no central group that determines what projects we will or won't do.
claims.speaker: Brian Dummann
claims.context: CDO Magazine interview on AstraZeneca's decentralized AI governance model
claims.rhetoricalFunction: Defines AstraZeneca's identity as decentralized, autonomous, non-hierarchical in AI adoption
claims.notes: Pre-existing specimen quote elevated to purpose claim; speaks to organizational character
